Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm a 55 years old , healthy individual (until I got diagnosed)Concerned about what type of treatment should I decide to go for. After my annual physical and my lab results back received a cll from my primary doctor requesting to go for another visit . He explained that my lab shows an elevated PSA and they were concerned as it was my first PSA test ever. The doctor give me a round of antibiotics and I was scheduled for another visit and a new lab work . PSA test comes elevated once again and a third one. After my last PSA test results the doctor decided to proceed with the cystoscopy and the biopsy at the same time. Results posted below. He recommended complete removal of the prostate. The results of my biopsy were posted today. . Got diagnosed with Gleason 6 (3+3 and 3+3) PSA Total, Scrn 4.7 ng/mL (High) Date Jul 14, 2015 PSA Total, Diag 5.5 ng/mL (High) Date Aug 05, 2015 PSA Total, Diag 5.7 ng/mL (High) Date Aug 18, 2015 ELEVATED PSA H) Prostate, L2, left mid, needle biopsy: Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+3=6, involving 30% of the biopsy. I) Prostate, L3, left apex, needle biopsy: Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+3=6, involving 90% of the biopsy. G) Prostate, L1, left base, needle biopsy: Focal high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia. A-F, J-L) Prostate, right and left lobe sites as listed, needle biopsies: Benign prostatic tissue with patchy chronic inflammation and atrophy. Any help/advise/suggestion will be really appreciate.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm a 55 years old , healthy individual (until I got diagnosed)Concerned about what type of treatment should I decide to go for. After my annual physical and my lab results back received a cll from my primary doctor requesting to go for another visit . He explained that my lab shows an elevated PSA and they were concerned as it was my first PSA test ever. The doctor give me a round of antibiotics and I was scheduled for another visit and a new lab work . PSA test comes elevated once again and a third one. After my last PSA test results the doctor decided to proceed with the cystoscopy and the biopsy at the same time. Results posted below. He recommended complete removal of the prostate. The results of my biopsy were posted today. . Got diagnosed with Gleason 6 (3+3 and 3+3) PSA Total, Scrn 4.7 ng/mL (High) Date Jul 14, 2015 PSA Total, Diag 5.5 ng/mL (High) Date Aug 05, 2015 PSA Total, Diag 5.7 ng/mL (High) Date Aug 18, 2015 ELEVATED PSA H) Prostate, L2, left mid, needle biopsy: Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+3=6, involving 30% of the biopsy. I) Prostate, L3, left apex, needle biopsy: Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+3=6, involving 90% of the biopsy. G) Prostate, L1, left base, needle biopsy: Focal high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia. A-F, J-L) Prostate, right and left lobe sites as listed, needle biopsies: Benign prostatic tissue with patchy chronic inflammation and atrophy. Any help/advise/suggestion will be really appreciate.
